intro: Vismia baccifera var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved vismia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered yellowish flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous small, black seeds. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, often found in coastal and coastal forest habitats. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation areas.
